title: Genesis Chapter 29 Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of Genesis chapter 29 with 16 questions covering key people, places, events, and teachings from this chapter.

questions.question: According to Genesis 29:1, who went on his journey?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:1 states: "Then Jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the people of the east."

questions.question: According to Genesis 29:4, who said unto them?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:4 states: "And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they said, Of Haran are we."

questions.question: Who said "unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they said, Of Haran are we" in Genesis 29:4?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:4 states: "And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they said, Of Haran are we."

questions.question: According to Genesis 29:10, who went near?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:10 states: "And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban his mot..."

questions.question: According to Genesis 29:17, who was tender eyed?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:17 states: "Leah was tender eyed; but Rachel was beautiful and well favoured."

questions.question: Who said "I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter" in Genesis 29:18?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:18 states: "And Jacob loved Rachel; and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter."

questions.question: According to Genesis 29:21, who said unto Laban?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:21 states: "And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto her."

questions.question: Who said "unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto..." in Genesis 29:21?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:21 states: "And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto her."

questions.question: According to Genesis 29:31, who was hated?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:31 states: "And when the LORD saw that Leah was hated, he opened her womb: but Rachel was barren."

questions.question: Who said "Surely the LORD hath looked upon my affliction; now therefore my husband will..." in Genesis 29:32?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:32 states: "And Leah conceived, and bare a son, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Surely the LORD hath looked upon my..."

questions.question: Where was Jacob according to Genesis 29:4?
questions.explanation: Genesis 29:4 states: "And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they said, Of Haran are we."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 29:2: "And he ______, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks:..."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that..."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 29:3: "And ______ were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the w..."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and..."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 29:5: "And he said unto them, ______ ye Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We ______ him."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And he said unto them, Know ye Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know him."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 29:6: "And he said unto them, Is he well? And they said, He is well: and, behold, ______ his daughter cometh with the sheep."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And he said unto them, Is he well? And they said, He is well: and, behold, Rachel his daughter cometh with the sheep."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 29:7: "And he said, Lo, it is yet ______ day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the sheep, and go and feed them."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And he said, Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the she..."
